Articles.Content: I don't think you could hit my X-32 in a real time battle.

I don't think you could hit my X-32 in a real time battle.

Maybe, maybe not, since I'm not a spectacular pilot.

In any case, while testing my new SSTO fighter (designated the "XD-X") I managed to pull off some quite amazing aerial stunts with it, such as power-slides and flipping the plane (losing control), then dramatically pulling out of the self-induced stall and rocketing low over the R&D Center.

Also, here's a some what better view of the bird:

Also, a dogfight against your X-32 would be interesting, considering that I got a bit of inspiration from (oddly enough) the Northrop YF-23 Black Widow II.
If multiplayer comes then we will have to dogfight these.

The 64-bit is here!

Time to build a space battleship.
My KSP seems to be broken now! All my missiles appear to be burning even with the engines off.
Happened to me when I went to 0.23.5 Daemon. It's KSP :/
I can't wait! I have to go to school before I can get the update so the day will now seemingly take 58 hours to end.

Better hurry. I've just finished my TRUE next-gen SSTO fighter (w/ VTOL):

http://i.imgur.com/hQkarmn.png

I can't wait to upgrade my PC so it won't go into conniptions trying to record flight via FRAPS...

I've been working on this.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I've been working on this.

http://imgur.com/a/kWwBN

Wow! That's quite the aircraft.

Do you think you could test out the SX-3 against this? I want to see how two hybrid armor beasts fare against each other.

http://www./view/01cngsdxent92xz/Hydra.craft
I'll test it against Victory if my computer doesn't melt.

I fired four I-beams at the Hydra and managed to hit a weak spot, doing excessive damage, I then reloaded and aimed for the same spot and got the same result.

I managed to destroy the command module every time and managed to obliterate the ship with an SRB.

Also, thanks to 64bit the 956 parts together was no problem.

Anyway, I only took one screenshot after the second hit:

Hey daemon, I've been getting the same bug you have with 0.24. All my i-beam missiles, or any separator rocket+probe stack disk type round for that matter, are completely useless.

They lack any way to launch (the game refuses to acknowledge that there is even a missile on a docking port), and the only fix is to recover a craft and re-arm it with missiles produced post-0.24 update.

In light of this, (and your Kraken issues in our battle,) do you wish to re-start? Perhaps with a smaller amount of craft, and more advanced units?

If you don't, I completely understand and will attempt to make my move however I can.

EDIT: This might just a problem with 64 bit. If so, I'll stick to my laggy 32 bit install.

Edited July 18, 2014 by ScriptKitt3h
My I-beams worked fine, the craft fired them all perfectly just like in 23.5

Hey daemon, I've been getting the same bug you have with 0.24. All my i-beam missiles, or any separator rocket+probe stack disk type round for that matter, are completely useless.

They lack any way to launch (the game refuses to acknowledge that there is even a missile on a docking port), and the only fix is to recover a craft and re-arm it with missiles produced post-0.24 update.

In light of this, (and your Kraken issues in our battle,) do you wish to re-start? Perhaps with a smaller amount of craft, and more advanced units?

If you don't, I completely understand and will attempt to make my move however I can.

EDIT: This might just a problem with 64 bit. If so, I'll stick to my laggy 32 bit install.

My 32 bit doesn't even work anymore. And my 64 bit is just as laggy as the old 32 bit. We can restart, but I'm still trying to get KSP to work.

I'm not trying to be insensitive, but I made slight updates to my SA-6 missile launcher. I already had a prototype a few months ago, and I do not support Putin.

Missile accelerating.

Honestly I think we should start doing battles by Budget instead of Tonnage, it'll force people to innovate and redesign.
lol It's exactly the same plane. Please credit the original author of the design.
Darthzeus please don't steal designs without giving credit where it's due.

lol It's exactly the same plane. Please credit the original author of the design.

I second this, it is 100% the same, with the exception of paint.

lol It's exactly the same plane. Please credit the original author of the design.
